result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward R Tomczak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Felony Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed. Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Imposed and Stayed. Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment and or schooling. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. No contact with the victim without expressed consent of victim as well as agent. Comply with family court orders. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement

Corrected 10/26/22 to change to felony U severity

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward R Tomczak

records.addlTxt: Amended to fix severity
Letters from DCC Records staff to Court regarding sentence structure

9:30 AM Defendant Edward R Tomczak in court.  Attorney Brett A Ekes in court for Edward R Tomczak.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - NO CONTEST. 
Factual basis found in complaint. 
BTC: GUILTY. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 
Defendant gives statement. 

BTC: 
2 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 1 year initial confinement with 1 year extended supervision imposed and stayed. 
2 years probation.

Conditions of probation:
60 days Racine County Jail STAYED
No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. 
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
No contact with the victim without expressed consent of victim as well as agent. 
Comply with family court orders. 
Firearm warning.
Voting warning.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge

Defendant is eligible for CIP.
Defendant is eligible for SAP.

Defense requests plea/sentencing date. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

BTC: Matter set over.

Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on June 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defense motions to lift no contact 
State objects to bond mod 
BTC; Motion to lift no contact to no violent contact DENIED but can allow contact through therapy setting and can have communication with children
